intro: Impatiens guillaumetii, commonly known as the Guillaumet's impatiens, is a flowering plant native to the tropical rainforests of western Africa. It belongs to the family Balsaminaceae and is characterized by its delicate, showy flowers that typically come in shades of red, pink, and white. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves with a slightly hairy texture, and it thrives in moist, shaded environments. It is often found growing along forest floors or in the understory of dense vegetation. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
